# kubectl_patch (Action)

Patches an existing Kubernetes resource using Server-Side Apply. This action is fire-and-forget: it applies the patch when invoked but does not track state or revert changes on destroy. Use this for one-shot operations like triggering a rollout restart, scaling a deployment, or toggling a feature flag.



<!-- action schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `api_version` (String) Kubernetes API version of the target resource (e.g., `v1`, `apps/v1`).
- `kind` (String) Kubernetes resource kind of the target resource (e.g., `ConfigMap`, `Deployment`).
- `name` (String) Name of the target Kubernetes resource.
- `patch` (Dynamic) An object containing the fields to patch on the target resource. This is merged into the target using Server-Side Apply.

### Optional

- `field_manager` (String) The name to use for the field manager. Default: `TerraformAction`.
- `force_conflicts` (Boolean) Force changes against conflicts. Default: `true`.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace of the target Kubernetes resource. Omit for cluster-scoped resources.
